TopicTitle: Side-by-side Kerbol system vs Solar system

Articles.Content:
As the picture is quite long, you'll probably need to zoom in to see all the details.

Each pixel in this picture represents 50,000km. At this scale, Kerbol is 5px across.

Range shows each planets periapsis and apoapsis, using information off wikipedia or the KSP wiki respectively. Note that Kerbin has a 0 eccentricity orbit.

Inclination is not shown.

KSP system is the lower one.

Edited July 24, 2013 by kahlzun
We're (Kerbals) cooler than humans because it doesn't take five million m/s of delta v to get to our farthest planet!
Well... I would like to see it... but it's so tiny...
